questions.Question: Article 359 of the Constitution authorizes the president of India to suspend the right to move any court for the enforcement of Fundamental Rights during :
questions.optionB: A failure of constitutional machinery in States
questions.solution: Solution:		Where a Proclamation of Emergency is in operation, the President may by order declare that the right to move any court for the enforcement of such of 1[the rights conferred by Part III (except articles 20 and 21)] as may be mentioned in the order and all proceedings pending in any court for the enforcement of the rights so mentioned shall remain suspended for the period during which the Proclamation is in force or for such shorter period as may be specified in the order.

questions.Question: The correct chronological order of the formation of Haryana, Sikkim, Arunanchal Pradesh and Nagaland as full states of Indian Union is :
questions.solution: Solution:		Nagaland on 1st December 1963. Haryana on 1st November 1966. Sikkim on 16th May 1975. Arunachal Pradesh on 20th Feb 1987.

questions.Question: The speaker of the Lok Sabha can ask a member of the house to stop speaking and let another member speak. This phenomenon is known as :
questions.solution: Solution:Yielding the floor. The speaker of the Lok sabha can ask a member of the house to stop speaking and let another member speak. Crossing the floor: Passing between the member addressing the House and the Chair which is considered breach of Parliamentary etiquette. Point of Order: A Member of Parliament may raise a point of order if he feels that the proceedings of' the House do not follow the normal rules. The presiding officer decides whether the point of order raised by the member should be allowed. Calling Attention Motion: With the prior permission of the Speaker, any member of the Parliament may call the attention of a Minister to a matter of urgent public importance. The Minister may make a brief statement about the matter or he may ask for time to make a statement later.

questions.Question: By which Constitutional Amendment Act was the number of Lok sabha seats increased from 525 to 545 ?
questions.solution: Solution:		31st Constitutional Amendment Act, 1973 - By this amendment the seats of Lok Sabha was increased from 525 to 545 but reduced the representatior of UT's in Lok Sabha from 25 to 20.

questions.Question: The first Backward Class commission was appointed in 1953 under the chairmanship of :
questions.solution: Solution:Kaka Kalelkar Commission:The Backward Class Commission was appointed in 1953 with Kaka Kalelkar as the Chairman. The Commission was asked to determine the criteria to be adopted to provide concessions to “socially and educationally backward classes” besides the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes; the Commission was also asked to prepare a list of such classes.

questions.Question: Which of the following is used in pencils?
questions.solution: Solution:		Graphite is used in pencils.

questions.Question: Which of the following metals forms an amalgam with other metals?
questions.solution: Solution:		Almost all metals can form amalgams with mercury, the notable exceptions being iron, platinum, tungsten, and tantalum.

questions.Question: Chemical formula for water is
questions.solution: Solution:		Chemical formula for water is H2O.

questions.Question: The gas usually filled in the electric bulb is
questions.solution: Solution:		Incandescent light bulbs are filled with an inert gas like nitrogen, argon, or krypton - so that the filament doesn't catch fire. Early ones were a vacuum.

questions.Question: Washing soda is the common name for
questions.solution: Solution:		Sodium carbonate decahydrate, also known as washing soda, is the most common hydrate of sodium carbonate containing 10 molecules of water of crystallization.

questions.Question: The tree which sends down roots from its branches to the soil is known as:
questions.solution: Solution:		The tree which sends down roots from its branches to the soil is known as banyan tree.

questions.Question: Electric bulb filament is made of
questions.solution: Solution:		Electric bulb filament is made of tungsten.

questions.Question: Brass gets discoloured in air because of the presence of which of the following gases in air?
questions.solution: Solution:		Brass gets discolored in air because of the presence of Hydrogen sulphide.

questions.Question: Which of the following is a non metal that remains liquid at room temperature?
questions.solution: Solution:Bromine is a chemical element with symbol Br and atomic number 35. It is the third-lightest halogen, and is a fuming red-brown liquid at room temperature that evaporates readily to form a similarly coloured gas. Its properties are thus intermediate between those of chlorine and iodine.

questions.Question: Chlorophyll is a naturally occurring chelate compound in which central metal is
questions.solution: Solution:		One such chelate is chlorophyll, the green pigment of plants. In chlorophyll the central ion is magnesium, and the large organic molecule is a porphyrin. The porphyrin contains four nitrogen atoms that form bonds to magnesium in a square planar arrangement.

questions.Question: Quartz crystals normally used in quartz clocks etc. is chemically
questions.optionC: A mixture of Germanium Oxide and Silicon dioxide
questions.solution: Solution:		The working of Quartz is usually by a crystal oscillator. The Silicon dioxides are the crystals which are piezoelectric and can be further used as speakers and microphones.

questions.Question: Which of the gas is not known as green house gas?
questions.solution: Solution:		The list of Green House Gases are as follows: 1) Water vapor

questions.Question: Bromine is a
questions.solution: Solution:		Bromine (Br), chemical element, a deep red noxious liquid, and a member of the halogen elements, or Group 17 (Group VIIa) of the periodic table.

questions.Question: The hardest substance available on earth is
questions.solution: Solution:		Diamond is regarded to be the hardest known material in the world.

questions.Question: The variety of coal in which the deposit contains recognizable traces of the original plant material is
questions.solution: Solution:		The variety of coal in which the deposit contains recognizable traces of the original plant material is peat.
